articles.title: What is a NullPointerException, and How Do I Fix It?
articles.description: NullPointerException (NPE) is a Java runtime exception thrown when code accesses a null reference (e.g., calling a method on null). Core Concept Trigger: Attempting to use a null object reference (e.g., null.length()). Type: Unchecked exception; occurs at runtime, not compile time. Example: String name = null; System.out.println(name.length()); // Throws NPE Stack Trace: Points to the line; trace upward for root cause. Common Causes Uninitialized References: Variables default to null if not set.

articles.title: Because the existing Mermaid diagram editors online produce unattractive charts, I created a new one.
articles.description: https://modern-mermaid.live I've been using Mermaid for flowcharts and diagrams for a while, but I always felt that the available online editors just produce ugly, unpolished charts. So I decided to build a new Mermaid editor from scratch. It features a modern, clean interface, multiple visual themes including hand-drawn and Studio Ghibli styles, real-time preview, and high-quality export options (PNG/JPG). I‚Äôd love to hear what the community thinks‚Äîfeedback and suggestions are welcome!
